evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: b. Executive Order 14151 On January 20, 2025, the President issued Executive Order No. 14151, entitled 'Ending Radical and Wasteful Government DEI Programs and Preferencing.' Exec. Order 14151, 90 Fed. Reg. 8339 (Jan. 20, 2025) (“EO 14151”).

extracted.value: President issued Executive Order 14151 on January 20, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: b. Executive Order 14168 On January 20, 2025, the President also issued Executive Order 14168, 'Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government.' Exec. Order 14168, 90 Fed. Reg. 8615 (Jan. 20, 2025) (“EO 14168”).

extracted.value: President issued Executive Order 14168 on January 20, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: c. Executive Order 14173 On January 21, 2025, President issued Executive Order No. 14173, entitled 'Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-Based Opportunity.' Exec. Order 14173, 90 Fed. Reg. 8633 (Jan. 21, 2025) (“EO 14173”).

extracted.value: President issued Executive Order 14173 on January 21, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: 3. February 10, 2025 – The Secretarial Directive – Challenged Directive 2 On February 10, 2025, Acting Secretary Fink, issued the following 'Secretarial Directive on DEI-Related Funding' ('the Secretarial Directive').

extracted.value: Acting Secretary Fink issued the Secretarial Directive on DEI‑Related Funding on February 10, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: 8. February 28, 2025 – The Grant Terminations Begin On February 28, 2025, the first batch-terminations occurred.

extracted.value: The first batch of grant terminations began on February 28, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: The March 25 Guidance settled on an examples list of: 'China,' 'DEI,' 'Transgender issues,' 'Vaccine Hesitancy', 'COVID-related' research.

extracted.value: The March 25, 2025 Staff Guidance (Priorities Directive) listed examples including China, DEI, Transgender issues, Vaccine Hesitancy, and COVID‑related research.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: The Court has found as fact that there was pervasive racial discrimination in selecting grants for termination.

extracted.value: The Court found pervasive racial discrimination in selecting grants for termination.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: The Court finds by the fair preponderance of the evidence that the grant terminations here at issue demonstrate an unmistakable pattern of discrimination against women’s health issues.

extracted.value: The Court found gender discrimination in grant terminations.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: The Court’s factual finding that there has been extensive discrimination against everyone whose lived experience of their sexuality is in any way different from the executive orthodoxy expressed in the President’s fiat, see Exec. Order 14168, 90 Fed. Reg. 8615 (Jan. 20, 2025), is fully affirmed.

extracted.value: The Court found LGBTQ+ discrimination in grant terminations.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment
evidence.text: The actions were randomly reassigned to this Court on May 1, 2025.

extracted.value: Consolidated actions were randomly reassigned to this Court on May 1, 2025.
